result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse R Matusewic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court deems defendant eligible for any and all programs that are available or that become available in the future.
Concurrent with: Iron County Case Nos. 17CF28 and 17CF42.
Concurrent with: Iron County Case Nos. 17CF28 and 17CF42.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse R Matusewic

records.addlTxt: of Conviction and Order - ERP
to Judge Stella from DOC

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Sentence 9-11-17

Def appears in person, in custody, with Attorney Sam J. Filippo.  Matthew J. Tingstad appeared on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case and cites appearances.  Atty Filippo states agreement.  In 17CF28 and 17CF42, def waives prelim on both cases. and reading of informations on both cases per Atty Filippo.  16CF51, sentence to be concurrent.  On FO cases, 217 and 218, def pleads guilty, dismiss 226.  In 17CF28, def to plead NC to Counts 1 and 2.  DRI others.  In 17CF42, def to plead NC to Counts 6 and 7.  Dismiss others. Joint recommendation of 3 years Prison and 1 year of ES.  40 days CTS, eligible for any probgrams.  Court finds def eligible for CIP and Subst. Abuse.  DA agrees as stated by atty Filippo.  As to 17CF28, def pleads NC to Count 1 and 2 per Atty Filippo.  Def agrees, no coercion.  As to 17CF42, def pleads NC to two counts of Bail Jumping per atty, def agrees, no coercion.  PLQs filed.  Def admits freely signing.  Atty Filippo satisfied def freely, knowingly and intelligently pleads.  Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of all counts as stated.  Dismisses all other counts.  Right of allocution.  Per DA, victims are present.  Joe S.  makes statement.  Shelly-makes statement.  Def exercises right of allocution.  Court sentences def as follows in all cases: 3 years Prison/1 year ES concurrent on all counts.  Court addresses def.  Deems def eligible for every program available.  One set of costs, determines DNA sample already on file.  No sentence on FOs.
Pre-trial conference on September 11, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jesse R Matusewic in court with attorney Sam Joseph Filippo.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  (Back on record from a.m. )  Atty Filippo calls 17CF28, 17CF42 and 16CF51.  Today is initial appearance on 42 and 28.  Atty Filippo wants bond review first.  DA states nothing has changed, requests bond remain in place.  Court orders bond to continue.  Atty Filippo requests prelim on both cases.  Prelim to be scheduled within 10 days.  Adj. 1:35 p.m.
Pre-trial conference on September 11, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant appeared in person, in custody.  Matthew J. Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 11:11 a.m.  New possible charges.  DA requests $1,000 cash bond.  Court questions def.  Public def info given to def.  Rochelle C. addresses Court.  Court sets $1,000 cash bond.  No contact with children, no alcohol, no controlled substances, testing on demand.  Omnibus per court.  Adj. 11:16 a.m.  klr

This bond covers 16CF51, 17CF28 and pending charges.  Defendant shall have no contact with his children.  Defendant shall not possess firearms.    Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or any controlled substance.  Defendant shall submit to chemical testing on demand.
Pre-trial conference on August 14, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Matthew J. Tingstad appeared on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.  Def appeared in person.  DA calls case at 10:48 a.m.  Cites appearances.  Def advises has trouble getting attorney.  Court addresses def.  Advised to contact Public Def again.  Atty Hoffmann was priour attorney.  To be continued for two weeks.  To let court know if needs assistance.  Bond continues.  All cases to track together.  Also called were cases 16FO217, 16FO218, 16CF51, 16FO226.  Adj. at 10:52.  klr
Pre-trial conference on July 24, 2017 at 10:30 am.
to WIthdraw as Counsel

Defendant Jesse R Matusewic in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls all cases.  Cites appearances.  Atty Hoffmann has filed a Motion to Withdraw.  Court grants motion.  Court grants def until July 24th to appear for Initial Appearance on 17CF28 and 16CF51 to be STC with new attorney.  Bond continues.  Adj. 1:15 p.m.  klr
Defendant's Attorney's Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw As Counsel (with attached proposed Order)
Sentencing hearing on July 6, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 11:08 a.m.  Cites appearances.  DA makes motion to adjourn to a date consistent with defense counsel's calendar.  Court grants motion.  Adj.  11:09 a.m.  klr
Sentencing hearing on April 13, 2017 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Jesse R Matusewic in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 2:41 p.m.  Def is to plead guilty to 16FO217 and 218 but sentencing to be scheduled at a later date.  Def pleads NC to Count # 1 of 16CF51 and guilty to 16FO217 and 218.  No coercion.  Court accepts pleas.  Finds def freely pleads.  Sentencing to be set at a later date.  Adj. 2:46 p.m.  klr
Pre-trial conference on March 30, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann in court.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 11:55 a.m.  Def fails to appear.  Bench warrant authorized at discretion of DA's office.  Citations to track together.  Adj. 11:56 a.m.  klr
Pre-trial conference on March 16, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Jesse R Matusewic in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 1:56 p.m.  Cites appearances.  Also calls 16FO226,218, 217.   Defendant waives right to prelim.  Case to be set for PTC.  Info filed.  Per atty Hoffman, info same as complaint, def understands and waives reading.  Stands mute.  Clerk to enter NG pleas on all cases.  Citations to track together.  Adj. 2:21 p.m.  klr
Preliminary hearing on February 9, 2017 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Jesse R Matusewic in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Matthew J. Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 10:57 a.m., cites appearances.  16CF51 is set for prelim.  Hoffmann addresses issue re witness.  Asks for adjournment to February 9th.  DA responds.  Defense motion granted by court to adjourn.  Citations to track with case.  Adj. 10:59 a.m.  klr
Preliminary hearing on January 17, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jesse R Matusewic in court with attorney Joseph S. Hoffmann.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cast at 10:13 a.m.  Cites appearances.  Also calls 16FO217 and 218.  Was scheduled for initial appeearance.  Per attorney Hoffmann, has been served with complaint, waives reading and wants prelim to be scheduled but def waives time limits for prelim.  Bond continues per court.  Adjourned at 10:16 a.m.  klr Defendant Jesse R Matusewic in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Frederick j Schellgell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance on December 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on December 12, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Frederick j. Schellgell appeared via phone for the State of Wisconson.  Defendant appeared in person, lodged.  Honorable Gary Carlson presiding via phone.  DA calls case, cites appearances.  Public defender information given to def.  DA states possible charges.  Rights explained to def.  Defendant understands options.  DA requests $1,000 signature bond, no possession of firearms.  Judge explains bond.  Sets as requested.  INIT on 11/28/16 at 10:30 a.m.  klr
NO POSSESSION OF FIREARMS.
